intro: Taraxacum cescae, commonly known as the alpine dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Europe and is characterized by its hairy, basal leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its life cycle includes a rosette of leaves that produces a flowering stem with a single flower head. Taraxacum cescae is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in meadows and slopes above the tree line.
